author: Special Correspondent
text:
The board put up by the administration of Jalakandeswarar temple informing devotees and visitors on the prescribed dress code.— Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

With the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department passing the order on dress code for devotees to enter temples, the onus lies with the police with regard to its implementation from January 1.

While disposing of a writ petition on November 26, 2015, seeking to direct the police to grant permission and protection for the conduct of ‘Gramiya Adal Padal Vizha’ on the Sri Shenbaga Vinayagar Temple premises, Akkiyampatti, Palayapalayam, Marungapuri Taluk in Tiruchi district, Justice S. Vaidyanathan of Madras High Court, Madurai Bench, suggested that a dress code be prescribed to devotees, including for children entering the temples for worship.

When contacted field-level officers in the Kancheepuram police district on Thursday said that they had not received any communication in this regard.
title: Dress code for devotees come into effect today
